snippet: Tia Norfleet has long portrayed herself as an accomplished driver, but the discrepancy between her true record and her public comments has drawn objections from racing officials.
abstract: Tia Norfleet, who gained national attention promoting her success as the first African-American woman to race in Nascar, draws criticism for discrepancy between her true record and her public comments.

byline.contributor: Ray Glier contributed reporting from Augusta, Ga. Jack Styczynski contributed research from New York.

lead_paragraph: Tia Norfleet has long portrayed herself as an accomplished driver, but the discrepancy between her true record and her public comments has drawn objections from racing officials.

headline.seo: A Driver’s Deeds Fail to Match Her Words
headline.main: A Nascar Driver’s Deeds Fail to Match Her Words
headline.print_headline: A Breakthrough Driver’s Deeds Fail to Match Her Words

keywords.value: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
keywords.name: organizations
